Review Text: The hotel is perfectly located in relation to the airport and access to the major roads to various destinations. Located in an area with little city noise. Close by a shopping mall. The staff is very friendly and helpful.  The hotel is not new and that can be seen from the rooms. But rooms are clean and room service efficient.

Check In: We walked in to the hotel without prior reservation and we want to check the room category before the process all i heard from the Associate is we cannot show the rooms in such rude tone. you can check the rooms in the TV screen. What a warm welcome would rate Zero as check in experience.   Same Associate mentioned a wrong figure for the room charges and we transferred the payment through third party as they advised their exchange rate is too low.   Room are not too spacious but cleaning wise is good.  Breakfast spread is small but chefs are good.  Check out Experience: pathetic, Because of the miscommunication we ended up paying more and they were supposed to do the refund as they mentioned it will be refunded back to the account received and as per my request we met

The location is 15-20 minutes from the Murtala International airport.  Check in in less than 5 minutes  The room is clean, and the space is about 18  m ,cattle and 2 bottles of water for free . It has a bar,restaurant serving the 3 meals and a small pool area.breakfast included in my booking and offering egg station,bacon,sausage ,rice,beef, or chicken with vegetables. American coffee and juices.employyes are very polite and helpful, especially Victor. One of the money value hotels in Lagos, I do recommend it if your business around Ikeja area. Note:Don't book a car from the hotel as it's very, very expensive, you can use Uber as it's safe and 75%cheaper.
Room Tips: Choose a room opposite from the pool side

Review Title: Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Location
Review Text: For a stay in Lagos Nigeria, this is a great hotel (I travel a lot and have been to the best resorts in Europe). I didn't expect the level of attention and service we received but we were wowed by the staff. Clean and modern hotel, perfect location for getting around lagos. The mall across the road was an added bonus with lots of places to eat and shop. When we had a misunderstanding with one of the staff, the manager  Margaret ensured it was resolved in a timely manner and even made it up to us.  Hotel food was great and room service was efficient. I recommend this hotel.

Review Title: The Staff At This Hotel Are Assets
Review Text: I spent 7 nights at Protea Hotel Ikeja Select. It was a trip I had made with my wife - who made made the pick of this hotel & done the booking.  Anie (the Hotel Manager) attended to us at the reception. She went above & beyond to receive is and make us feel welcome. This lady maintained superb consistency in terms of customer service through out our stay. She deserves to work in the best hotels in the world - She is "a natural" with guests.  The room was okay - Room 138. There was an issue with the hotel floor and water leaked on the floor when we flushed. Beyond that the hotel staff were there to attend to our every need.  I liked the proximity to Shoprite.  I will definitely be returning and would love to stay in this hotel again. It gave me value for my money.  Kudos to Anie,

Birthday surprise. After attending my friends mothers burial the next day was my birthday so we decided to change location to enjoy the day. The staff at the front desk where nice and friendly. The didn’t waste time checking us in.  Got to the room to my surprise birthday cake, champagne, chocolate, and gifts. It was a pleasant surprise cause I was so tired from Lagos horrible frustrating traffic. It lighten my mood. I had planed to take a bath and hit the sack. The hotel is clean and cute. The rooms aren’t that big, but still comfy for two. I had a lovely stay.

Review Title: Fantastic and caring service - always ready to help
Review Text: Right away from arranging pick up from airport, through check-in and the stay, the service was fantastic. What has really hit me is the friendliness of the people working at Protea. All the time you feel looked after and welcome. I also hosted a seminar and here too everything worked like clockwork. I can only say - try and stay at Protea Hotel Ikeja Select.

I was swayed towards this Hotel by some good reviews on Trip Advisor but was soon to find out i had made a huge mis judgement. I stayed for 2 nights Saturday 2/10/21 and Sunday 3/10/21. Checking in was slow as i was stuck behind a complete air crew checking in and there are only 2 check in desks at the hotel. The reception area doubles as  a meeting area with a small bar. Te dining room is tiny likewise the breakfast room. There is an outside space with a pool but very tight for sitting out. i was entertaining a client on Saturday evening so we gleefully had a drink at the bar whilst reviewing the menu which is al a carte no buffet which is unusual for a hotel i Lagos. We made 3 choices on the menu one after the other only to be told not available i suggested it would be

Review Title: Damp Room with Oduor and smelly sheets
Review Text: Damp room, smelly sheets. I made multiple requests to change room, none was granted as the staff were not cooperative and claimed there was no room. The room had an odour, I keep complaining until I checked out 6 days later. A waste of resources. I had to move back to Radisson Blu in GRA

It was amazing Experience in Protea hotel, Mr. Paul is amazing personality, very professional, fun loving and Enthusiastic, took care of Us very well at Pool side, ready to assist and can say really hardworking guy. All the very best to him, and hope to see him soon too. Thanks.
Review Text

Very welcoming and friendly staff, breakfast was good but a very busy hotel even though security adequate.   There is a need for a wide variety of meal options for lunch and dinner to accommodate guest with different dietary needs.   Please!!!! update your bathrooms in the rooms.

During my recent stay the passageway ceilings were under construction, the dust and dirt filtered into the rooms together with the noise. The breakfast was inedible. No coffee cups available and the only yoghurts available were off.

My first visit to Nigeria stayed at the hotel in Junior Suite for 4 days. Rooms are decently clean, beds are comfortable, bathroom has free toiletries and it gets replenished every day. Check-in was very prompt, however, the property looks very dated, furniture shows signs of wear and tear.  The staff are simple and polite in nature, The morning staff for breakfast was good and attentive, the breakfast spread is decent but can get boring if u stay for 3 or more days. There is free wifi available to do your work. The evening Bbq we tried the lamb was very dry and rubbery overcooked, their Pepper soup is really good. Enjoyed eating plaintains in all forms all the days.

This was my first stay at any of Protea's hotel.  The room was way better than expected, comfortable bed, good pillows and clean.  WiFi was fast and I had no issues with it. TV channel selection was limited but okay considering I was in Nigeria.  Staff was really helpful and check in and out was pretty swift.  The only thing is that they could improve on the breakfast buffet and room service.  I would stay again for the cleanliness and comfort.

Friendly staff...super warm welcome.. best chicken wings in town!!!! New chef, Eamonn,  has made a great impression with some superb adjustments to the breakfast layout.. Nothing is too much trouble for him.

Checked into the hotel for 2 nights. Got an upgrade to a junior suite which was a pleasant surprise. It got even better.! The rooms were clean and inviting. A welcome gift of juices and chocolates. a coffee station and ironing facilities. 2 toilettes, a barrier-free shower equipped with the basic toiletries.Comfy king size bed. Both the lounge and the bedroom were spacious. Location is good. Ikeja Shopping Mall within walking distance and government offices not too far away. The staff were extremely polite and efficient. The breakfast buffet offered a variety of food. The bbq meals outside by the pool were good - all you can eat and the à la carte had quite an selection.

The Protea Hotel Ikeja Select is an average business hotel. The hotel is very strategically located right across the road from the Ikeja City Mall and close to the Government offices in Alausa.  The staff are professional and try their best to respond to all request. Breakfast is nothing special. This was my second visit in 3 months and the breakfast menu doesn't change. There's not so much variety for the Nigerian breakfast. For the price, I think one can get something better within Ikeja.

The Protea Ikeja probably stacks up as a good hotel in Nigeria. I have visited a few Protea hotels in South Africa and these are by far of a higher standard. The hotel serves the purpose- it has noisy neighbors but is conveniently close  to airport and my business area.

Beautiful Place, Fantastic Staffs, Nice Food, Quality Treatment, Good setting.  I like the cocktail drink...  Creative Team and good management   Would always come back ... Would recommend to Family and Friends too.

Stayed just a couple of night. Staff are great very helpful and always available,  had the BBQ for dinner and cant fault it the food was great, decent steak and out of this world prawns.  Only problem i had was the WiFi that seemed to be on and off a lot of the time.  was a really nice touch on check in being offered a cold facecloth and water.  the chef was great a really friendly guy from south Africa i believe was always around and happy to help with and request.  Will definitely be back when next i come to Lagos for business.  Breakfast had lots of variety so i wasn't stuck for choice on my 3rd day always something different to try
Review Text

Staff are friendly but totally clueless about every little question. Room door doesn't latch at all, so anyone can push the door open. BBQ at night was so so. Leather style beef, dry chicken. Spicy chicken soup was delicious as was the chili sauce. Veggies cooked to death. Salad sauce ran out and when staff was aboard they did absolutely nothing apart from saying OK. Trying to get a decent fried egg at breakfast seems an impossibility. Understanding that there is a difference between cream (double cream or heavy cream) and full cream milk-forget it. The beef is a hard as a plank of wood. Lagos seems to think this standard is ok. Doesn't say much for the city and its people (patrons).

Decent hotel as it served me the purpose as it was just walking distance from the offices I had the job. But need improvements in food and services. Air conditioning does not work and other few things requires a lot of help

My client told me to book Protea Ikeja (forgetting that Radisson had bought the one he was thinking of). It was decent. I was literally there for about 8 hours! Fabulous staff!! But carpets need a clean.   Asked for an airport transfer but they didn't reply. The concierge organised an uber. Was not ideal at Lagos airport.

Review Title: Would stay again but needs improvement.
Review Text: The good: The food was great. The staff at reception desk was very helpful. Particularly the gentleman that works the graveyard shift (gets off at 7am). He assisted me occasionally and was always welcoming. They have some events at night by the pool area that’s pretty cool. (If you’re not trying to sleep). I liked the breakfast buffet and they take security seriously. The bed was very firm and comfy. Also loved the showers water pressure.   The bad: Upon checking into my room I saw a candy wrapper on the floor. Other than that, it looked clean. However, a hotel worth her salt wouldn’t make this kind of mistake. There was a strand of hair on my bed and also a pair of socks under the bed. (Didn’t even realize about the socks until the next day.. and no, it wasn’t mine). A

The staff are probably the best part of any stay at this establishment. Always ready to help. Their treatment of first-timers and Titanium or Platinum Elite members, is exemplary.  Breakfast is divine. I have stayed here for years since it opened and I have never had any cause to regret it.  Unlike most places that offer Croaker or Catfish - these guys go all the way to grill the most exquisite BARRACUDA fish.  The central Air conditioning is a problem - TOO COLD!!! Come into the hotel from the searing Ikeja heat, and within 5 minutes, you have forgotten about it. No cut corners when it comes to comfort.  The bed and bathroom amenities are above average, but could be better.  Oh - and did I mention about the staff?

Rooms are clean, the property is well maintained. Staff is also pleasant. but the services require improvement. response time is very slow. you have to request for regular amenities as these are rarely refilled other than the shower cap. even for slippers are provided on special request. the price is also a little high. the most convenient thing about protea is availability of halal meat and ikeja city mall.

Protea Select has always been a place that lives up to its billing. The staff members are quite courteous and the meals nice. One major thing is the cleanliness of the room and the prompt services from the staff when required.

Well what can I say about this hotel . The staff are superb , making everyone feel like they are part of a big family . The manager Fraser runs a superb hotel , takes the time to make sure everyone is looked after . The staff are superb and very friendly . The food selection is great and the chef oh wow the chef . Chef Benoit is the best I have ever come across .From the minute you meet him it feels like he is a member of your family , he makes you any dish you like and looks after everyone . This hotel has to be the best hotel I have stayed at , I don’t think any other hotel can beat the quality of this place . I have a video testimonial but cannot upload it on trip advisor .

This property is in a quiet street adjacent to Shoprite Ikeja. The shoprite mall has all amenities including phones, food, drinks and nightclub. The property is part of the Marriot group with Marriot standard. Professional and friendly staff. Clean rooms. Free WiFi. Swimming pool with poolside barbecue in the evening. Access to mainland and Island. Good security and nice food.

I had a good time at this facility. Staff are all very polite and friendly. Room and bathroom are also very cute and clean. Buffett breakfast is simple and nice as well. Had a great stay and value for monies overall.
Review Text

If you gonna be working in Ikeja. This is a great hotel. Location is nice and property is well maintained. Lots of places to eat nearby and nice little lobby. Busy hotel good service. Friendly staff. Food can take time.

VENUE  The hotel is situated in Ikeja The seat of government and so is very convenient in that regard and was easy to find as it is on the main road. Ikeja is close to the main international airport which is in the same area. The Shoprite shopping mall is right opposite the hotel so plenty of shopping nearby.   SECURITY  Our car was screened as we attempted to come through the gate and this was repeated each time we came in. The hotel is frequented by airline staff. There is an ATM machine at the entrance of the hotel - which is very thoughtful.  CHECK IN  I stayed six days. The exterior of the hotel at the entrance looked dusty and did not look as if it had seen any water at all that day. Coming from the Protea in Kuramo waters Lagos which is squeaky clean I immediately noticed

When customers thinking about hotel before going anywhere they think about running away from noise pollution and they seek peace when it comes to any hotel in the whole world everyone is looking for peace and calm and silence , my experience was horrible that I have to ask them please make the noise level less so people can have rest maintenance happening in the hotel with very high noises using the vacuum machine to clean with very high noises talking with loud voices in the hallway how people can rest the management should do something serious about the noise level we don’t want apology we want actions when I write about hotels or resorts they always reply that they are sorry I want to see I don’t want their sorrow anyway my sleep was disturbed..... when people will feel that

Amazing attention to detail as the customer service was the best I’ve seen in a long while. Hotel staff is very friendly and rooms were clean but the beds a little hard. The hotel kitchen food was amazing and the location was very secure. Very child friendly hotel. Will stay there again.

Arrived the hotel really tired and stressed out. Was attended to by nice polite staff at the front desk. Annie gave me lemon cold water  to drink it was really nice. Checked in and the same lady brought cold orange juice and a snack to my room.  Neat lovely rooms, but the best part for me was the comfy bed & the lovely shower. Was a pleasant 4 day stay. Hope to be back soon.

Went for lunch. Worn and not too clean rug. Dirty towel used in place of a foot mat. Felt more like a Motor Inn rather than a classy hotel. Had to ask for tables to be cleaned as no one was available to be welcome us into the restaurant. Food was great. So was the waiter.

I recently lodged 15 finish tourist here and I got a wonderful feedbacks. This was after a slight delay at the reception that seems small and makes the reception crowdy. The room service, food, drinks  and the rest of the services was good. Thank you.

I’m a regular guest in this hotel, and every time I stay it’s an amazing experience! The personnel is very friendly and helpful, the barbecue is amazing! If you meet the chef, ask him for the prawns... wow! The rooms are neat, clean and comfortable!

I received excellent reception from the hotel and from Mr. Victor and Ms. Florence at the front desk. The staff was friendly and respectful. The hotel responded promptly and positively to all my reasonable requests. The security precautions at the ground level and floor level are greatly appreciated. The guest room is very well kept and furnished.    The hotel is close to the Shoprite shopping center.  The breakfast that came with my reservation was excellent, with various options. It was the most satisfying breakfast of all my stays in Marriott hotels. The options for dinner were also great; Buffet or A la carte. I stuck with the latter every evening. But I did meet people who liked the former. The excellent meal service was provided by people like Mr. Sunday, Mr. Micheal, et

Near to the mall. Buy anything you need. Security top notch. Safe and secure. The food is great. Every time i come here i have the barbecue and its always a pleasure seeing Chef Benoit on top of everything. The only problem you will experience is, it is far from the airport considering Lagos traffic. The staff is very welcoming.  Before i leave, i must say, this hotel has the best mattresses i have ever slept on. The bathrooms need a bit improvement with more towels and cleaning. But you can always ask the reception to send someone to clean if you think its not up to your standard.
Review Text

I really enjoyed my stay,  and the reception given to me at the complimentary breakfast table.  Thanks for giving me the treat I desired. Kudos to the chef for taking time in making a very delicious delicacy for me.

Review Title: TOP STAY IN PROTEA HOTEL LAGOS
Review Text: Room is very clean, people are very nice, Concert at the swimming pool in the evening with BBQ buffet AND a special mention for THE chef Benoit. So nice, so after your needs. Hi cooking is marvelous. Bavo Chef

Review Title: A night of peaceful sleep after a vigorous night out!
Review Text: The hotel was chosen because of the numerous friday night hang-out spots around it. The check-in was seamless and I found the room comfortable. The bed is high and solid, but the pillows were not full. There was limited TV channel options. The bathroom didn't appear to have an extractor for all the steam from an immersive hot bath. The dining area was cozy, not a lot of variety for the breakfast buffet, but something to eat. it was great that the omelet is made on demand. :) :)- awesome. Security is great and it was easy to get around in the hotel. Restaurant service was quick for orders made past midnight.

The hotel is pretty much new and the rooms are well arranged. The pool is nice also. Spent a night there and I plan to visit again soon. The proximity to the airport makes it easier to get to the airport on time.

It was okay, Lovely environment, friendly staff. Good food. Lovely ambience. Neat spacious rooms.  Quiet area, didn't hear  the traffic. Slept really good. Nice comfy bed. Will be back to spend more time soon.

Very impressed by the check in process, the quality of the breakfast included morning buffet as well as the room itself. The Lagos location more than lives up to the Protea standard—very modern design and high quality amenities such as soaps and lotion, and very comfy bed. Didn’t have the opportunity to view the pool or gym, but it appears by the lobby guests that quite a few people were on vacation.  Highly recommend!

Review Title: Nice hotel for a quick layover
Review Text: I was transiting and stayed here twice. It’s a good place to rest between flights and get to the airport efficiently. The breakfast is a little sparse and the dining room a bit basic. But, these don’t matter much if you are in and out. Staff are very friendly and accommodating and it has an overall welcoming vibe.

The rooms re well maintained. Location is perfect, overlookin ikeja city mall. You can seat by the pool side n share drinks with friends. Staff is friendly too, generally i had a good time and wil recommend anytime.

Currently staying at the hotel and can honestly say its worth spending the extra money for the services rendered at this facility . From the front gate(security men) to the hotel room clean up crew they do a fantastic job!  Kudos to the staff at this location keep up the good work. A special thanks to the front desk crew very courteous and well informed about the hotel. A shout out to Elizabeth keep it up  Thanks

the hotel is very clean and quiet. I've always love Marriott brand and they did not disappoint. I have only one issue which I'm not rating them down for because I was too busy to bring it to the staffs' attention. I got two rooms for myself and friends and both rooms have a clogged sink. Apart from that, staff are excellent.
Review Text

We were having a very good time, very warm welcome and friendly staff.  We have a dinner and have a very good take care by Miss Mimi, she’s so polite and look after all of us all the time.   Also the dinner we have by chef. Benoit. He came to talk with us which made the atmosphere here so cool and true relaxing.   Thank you for your host.  I am looking forward to come here again :)

The staff is really, really, nice! The way they treat you really stands out. They serve very good food! The bar is small but has its share of good beers and wines. The rooms are comfortable. Definitely recommend this one.

It is always home whenever i visit from checkin-staff service and facility is always excellent. response time to issues quite impressive .proximity to the mall makes staying worth the while. maintenance and house keeping up on their game.

Good hotel in heart of lagos. Loaded with amenities, great hospitality, great food. Nice and pleasant stay. Booked it twice during Nigeria visit. No doubt first preference for stay in lagos. Walking distance from Ikeja mall. Half an hour away from international and domestic Airport.

As a Marriott Gold member, that was an easy choice. Lagos does not have a lot of reasonably priced good hotels.  This one fits the bill.  Hotel is nicely located next to the main mall in Ikeja...giving lots of social and food and shopping options.  Food at the hotel is good; very clean, secure place. Elevator, A/c, nice bed, nice breakfast, excellent staff.  One down side...internet was horrible...terrible...primitive. It has nothing to do with Nigeria...i had good internet in several nearby offices. They have to subscribe to a better provider. Other than that, price was reasonable...but pay in currency. They will jack you on the exchange rate if you use a foreign credit card.

This hotel has potential to be so much better than it was, felt safe with security at the gate and entrance, the staff were polite and professional but at check in the staff member assumed my husband and I weren't checking in together?? which resulted in only one set of towels and amenities for 1 in our room? The bathroom looked as if it was still in need of decorating and hadn't been finished properly and the water pressure in the basin was ridiculous. Unfortunately my husbands ipod was stolen by room cleaning staff as we forgot to put it in the safe so beware! The restaurant food was very tasty though with a great breakfast. Overall I wasn't totally dissatisfied but I wouldn't stay here again.

Great little hotel, slept so well here thanks to the comfy bed and the breakfast was gorgeous! Loved the Nigerian and European options, especially the plantain! Hotel staff friendly too and looking forward to coming back

Nice clean Hotel, friendly and attentive staff but rather highly priced for what you get. Plus a major con is the fact that there are no ice machines on each floor. If they are going to ask for American rates, at least give us American services

Considering that you are in Lagos and the last hotel (5 Star) I stayed did not have water in the bathroom every morning, this hotel was a welcome relief. Courteous staff and clean rooms. But only one lift? Strange! Close enough to the airport to avoid getting stuck in the infamous traffic.

Review Title: home away from home with staff that is mor like family
Review Text: found the entire property and its staff and management to be one of the best trained and accommodating that I've come across in Nigeria. The food was fantastic.  From the fruit bar at breakfast to the cosmopolitan and the authentic Nigerian.  Your palate is taken on a magical carpet ride. hmm hmm hmm
Review Text

Excellent service. All staff are friendly and easily approachable. Perfect place to stay if you are looking for a peaceful atmosphere filled with beautiful staff. The food is great but there could have more of a variety. Also a jacuzzi would be lovely to add. All in all it has been a great experience and I can't wait for my next holiday.

a warm welcoming service,friendly staffs and the rooms were amazing and comfortable. fell in love with the room,the hotel environment was spectacular the location is a cool and calm environs and the amenities are properly provide and kept for a good use. i love the professional work by all the staffs and also the meals were really nice. would always look forward to spending another time at the hotel.

I had excellent meals breakfast, lunch and dinner.  Looking forward to another wonderful experience of such especially with warm greetings by the good and well experienced staff. Including fast & easy access to the shopping mall & airport.

Review Title: It's ok for 1 night, no more
Review Text: Small hotel, little bit old but room are better than  expected and well  cleaned. The staff is very kind. Breakfast it's ok but the restaurant area it smells too much food and fried oil. The gym is totally useless,because is full of mosquitos. The swimming pool need some maintenance and cleaning.

Review Title: OK for a couple of nights
Review Text: There is some confusion among taxi drivers about this hotel as there is apparently another in Ikeja that they seem to confuse it with. Be sure to say it's in Alausa opposite Shoprite. Despite being only 8 km from the airport, it took me 25 mins to get there (at 9 pm) and could take longer in the rush hour.  I had booked online and the room was priced in USD, as was my confirmation. But on check-in I was asked to pay in NGN. So why not quote in NGN in the first place? That sort of thing causes a lot headaches with picky accountants handling expense claims.  My ground floor room was good. Great 'rain shower', decent wi-fi signal, nice and quiet. But the safe had been broken into and was unusable (see photos). The kettle didn't work and two requests to have it replaced went

Review Title: An excellent overnight stay- exceptional staff
Review Text: I was booked for an overnight stay on my way to Maiduguri by a local expert. It is near the airport but I arrived in early evening and our car crawled through the Lagos "go-slow*. The staff tolerated us waiting for a third person to come who had gone by accident to the OTHER Protea Hotel in Ikeja. (Be careful to get the right one if coming by taxi). Without Naira I could not tip the staff and they had no way of processing a card transaction for service. There was no problem paying for the meal. Choose from the buffet rather than a la carte. It is cheaper and high quality with plenty of choice. I apologised to reception for being a mean tipper and they said "no problem - maybe next time".

I stayed here for 4 nights before my marriage. The rooms are very nice as was the pool. The food was excellent. It was my first taste of Nigerian food. The staff offers excellent service. There is a shopping mall across the street. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a very nice quiet hotel in Lagos.

A steak is 7000 N and of some of the worst quality meat (extremely tough) you might get in Nigeria. Mixed salad is cucumbers and onions mostly > avoid at all cost. If you complain about the quality of the food, you are just ignored...  The house wine on the menu is Nederburg Cabernet Sauvignon but you get a very inferior Spanish wine instead...  Hotel otherwise is ok.

One of the best hotel in Lagos, the location of the hotel is perfect near a very big shopping mall and cinema, you can enjoy setting at the swimming pool where the area are very quite. The good thing about the hotel is the management and the working staff, they are very supportive and know how to make things work for you. Enjoy.

Review Title: My stay in protea selec Alausa Lagos
Review Text: The room I stayed, 143 has two windows, is spacious with a shower and wc. The shower drain point is steep cross slope which is uncomfortable to stand on. Further more without step into shower cubicle water tends to splash out. Otherwise the room is neat. The electric socket outlets two in no are not easily assessable because of their position.   The staff are the most honest you can find. Amongst the delegates we were in the hotel with, one left money in his pocket which were returned by the dry cleaners, another left her phone in the conference rom and returned from town to meet it. You are created to ask how your night was. The Internet in the hotel is quite fast. I enjoyed my browsing, WhatsApp face book etc. Our issue was with conference hall by the swimming pool. Has only
Review Text

Service excellent. Extremely safe (they have a full battalion of bodygards in the main entrance). Rooms are medium size but well equiped. They have a terrace +swimming pool in the back of the hotel, where you can only have a cigarrete or a full meal. Buffet was a little bit poor, but you can eat "a la carte". Wifi was ok and works trough the full hotel. I will definetly come back.

Enjoyed every bit of my stay and the breakfast was excellent! The combo English/Continental and African. The front desk(Josphine and Elizabeth) the waiters Tony, Rhoda and Victoria are wonderful people, they are all very professional...I can't forget the Chef who thinks of making your stay like a foodie trip! The ambience is great well nurtured flowers and the guards alert. Great place to spend the holidays!!

Good enough. Not the best place but definitely not the worst! Given the area and other options available this one is a decent choice.   Stayed here a couple times in the past month traveling through Lagos. Has reliable electricity with generator immediately taking over when the power company fails yet again. Air con works well. Fridge in each room and bottles of water ready for you. Nice shower.   Cleanliness is hit and miss. First visit recently was a nice clean room. Second was partly clean, with quite a few exceptions. Room service food was great once and cold the second time.   The shining star of this place is its staff. They are all super friendly and helpful. And the second time I came, as soon as I walked in one nice girl at the front desk immediately recognized me and

Second time in this hotel and like the first time, it was amazing! I had a very warm & personalized welcome back note from the GM in my room which made me feel special. Secondly, the location of this hotel (directly opposite Ikeja Mall and close to the Airport) makes it unbeatable to any other hotel in the city.' Thirdly, the Service is outstanding! Right from the Check-in at the reception, to House-Keeping, to the Security personnel, to the Bartender (who resumed work two days before my stay) and my Check-out at the Reception by an amazing lady, I loved the undivided attention from the staff. Also, the Cleanliness of this Hotel is Exceptional! Throughout my stay, I noticed that  House-Keeping did a very detailed and Fantastic job both in my room and the hotel surrounding in

It's my second visit to this hotel . Best part of this hotel is warm and friendly staff. It's a small hotel with all kind of facilities. They have a buffet breakfast and on Friday evening barbecue dinner .

Hello all..Ivisited this hotel 1st was in the year 2015,awarm welcome by GM and his wife,Most of the staff friendly,(clement,elizabeth,jeniffer,Tolu,richard,gerard,patrick,rhoda,liza,francis, etc..)there are more staff couldnt recall names.. I have seen a nice improvement in menu. The f&b teammostly has a theme dinner,decent b/f buffet in morning. Always staff members acknowledge and assist you.. Theres s small gym,business center,bar ares at lobby and pool in ground floor. Thankyou..!!

A great place to stay. Staff were friendly,caring and pleasant. Rooms were  well laid out and clean,meals were well presented and tasted delicious. The ambience was quiet comfortable for everyone. I will strongly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Lagos especially the ikeja-alausa area.Thank you. Omokore mrs

Protea hotel is a clean hotel in Lagos, for when you go for business and you need a safe place to stay from all points of view. The staff are very friendly, however do not expect amazing hotel facilities. The lobby is very small, same for the gym and pool which I never dared to use it. The sun doesn't come there to get some tan if you decide to stay outside the room for some time and if there is a second person using the pool, I already feel like they are taking my personal space. Food is also acceptable, and the rooms are clean and comfortable. However, one night for business is just enough to spend there.

Very decent room and proximity to the mall makes it the best choice for the mainland breakfast is nice and with a wide range to select from. Planning to spend my Marriotts point during the Christmas there with the family

Was in this hotel because of my Marriott status, as I used both points and cash. The first staff that welcome me and checked me in was very welcoming but not straight forward. When I got into the room I was checked in it was different from what I saw on Marriott web, when I call and complain I was told they are fully booked. When I threaten to checked out and never to stay there my room was latter change. This is the first hotel that I experience down grate instead of an upgrade at checked inn as an Elite member.
Review Text

Nice clean rooms, Good food, Good location (Next to the mall) and an EXCELLENT CUSTOMER SERVICE. It was my first time staying in the hotel and i felt really sad that i'll be spending my birthday in Nigeria away from my family but to my surprise, it turned out the best birthday ever! The staff were warm and accommodating, i can see that they love what they are doing, thanks to their General Manager Fraser who really did well in leading his team, to Simon the chef for the sumptuous dinner who took time to greet everyone who were dinning despite being busy in the kitchen, to Joy, Margret for their thoughtful gestures, and to the the rest of the staff, THANK YOU ALL for making me feel i'm part of your family.  It was an experience that i will not forget.

Nice small hotel , avarage rooms. Friendly staff. The manger from South Africa and staying in the hotel, very active man ,food is mostly is nigerian , salat bar is very poor, The quality of bread in the hotel is very BAD and always not fresh I recommend to buy your own bread from shoprite cross the road Security is good Very small lobby with no place to set except the bar which has 5 seats

My luck, I chose to be staying on a business trip whilst the general manager had travelled somewhere so I was told and apparently the chef was the manager also .  The bed was so hard that I could not sleep . Unfortunately I could not change bed and breakfast because my boss had travelled . I am not extravagant so that's why I had to say this review.

Review Title: Great location and good customer service
Review Text: Services at this hotel is on par with many Marriott hotels in the USA.I stayed at this property for 11 days, I particularly appreciated the courtesy late check-out. I will definitely here on my next vacation to Lagos.

It was my short and wonderful stay with this hotel. Their rooms are clean nice with all basic amenities but no hairdryer in the room. With warm and friendly staff they make my stay comfortable. It was a barbecue dinner night the day I arrived which was great. The food was really nice . With gym , swimming pool , wifi and complimentary breakfast my stay was just simply awesome.

This is hotel is home away from home. I always look forward to my stay here. Proximity to the airport and 5 minutes walk to the Ikeja mall makes it a perfect choice. Wonderful service you will always cherish, the front desk staff are very warm and responsive. You can start your evening with good freshly squeezed fruit juices with the company of other residents at the bar during Happy Hours. The meals are super! I love the breakfast and enjoy the grill, stir fry, and BBQ nights. During your stay, you will enjoy the company of the GM - Fraiser, and the Financial controller - John. If you need anything, talk to Joy- the Service Manager. She supported my enrolment on the Marriott rewards and the experience has been super interesting. I get my points after every stay at the hotel. If

Although we checked in during busy time for the hotel staff, every person welcomed us with the smile and hospitality. BBQ was amazing! (Starts from 6:00pm) However, it was so loud outside at night that I couldn't sleep at all. I had a business meeting the next morning, but I felt tired all day because of it. The staff should not assign any customers to the room which is close to the street on weekends. Karaoke party went on and on until the early morning..I hope no one will have the same issue as me. Other than that, I liked this hotel!!

If you are looking for somewhere to stay in Ikeja - look no further!  This is my fourth time back to this hotel.  It is not far from the airport, is modern and clean and is well situated as it is also next to the Ikeja Mall - one of the biggest malls in Lagos.   What  differentiates this hotel for others I have stayed at are the staff and management  - they are so welcoming and friendly.  It feels like home away from home.  The Wi-Fi is also good.

If you want a place to stay close to the airport and also with good shopping nearby this place is excellent.  The standards of the rooms are as  you would expect in an international hotel and nothing like a normal Nigerian hotel.  You can get a decent rate too.  Ikeja Mall is just a 5 minute walk away with shops restaurants and cinemas so you don't have to stay stuck in your room.  Staff friendly and welcoming.  But if your business is downtown then it is a long drive to an fro and the traffic can drive you insane.  I have stayed here for a few nights every month for the past 7 months.

If you have to go to Lagos, this is a fine little hotel with a good restaurant, bar, pool, free wifi, and nice rooms.  The South African couple who run the place are very friendly and present.  The property is security-gated and all cars coming in are checked.
Review Text

Review Title: Very New - Needs a little Improvement
Review Text: We live in Lagos and need a getaway every now and then so we tried Protea Select.  We recently purchased the ProKard which gives great discounts on food and some vouchers for one free night, or stay one night get one free.  The hotel is very new and clean.  Restaurant area is very small, but cozy.  They have a small pool and area that you can sit and relax.  When we ordered dinner they were out of some major things.  They apologized and tried to accommodate us the best they could.  I believe the staff is very friendly and willing to help any way they can.  The room is very nice as far as appearance.  Modern and clean.  Small, but comfortable.  Shower is outstanding - especially when living in Lagos you know that is not a normal commodity.  Plenty of towels.  Fridge in room. Bed

I am coming for some years on business to Lagos and have tried different hotels on Victoria Island and in Ikeja. This time I stayed at the Protea Hotel Select Ikeja. After I arrived first at the wrong Protea Hotel, because in Ikeja three Protea Hotels are situated, I was presently surprised. The hotel is in very good condition, all the bathroom fittings are working, the room (308) is very clean and quiet. The staff from the manager down is fantastic and very helpful.  Most importantly the internet connection is fast and reliable. The only slightly week point is the the hotel does not offer transport from the airport and has a limited number of TV channels. But I definitely will come back the next time I am on business in Lagos

Review Title: Home Away from Home in Humid, hot Lagos
Review Text: This hotel is strategically located in this hot, humid city of Lagos, being a few minutes away from a recently built state of the art shopping mall. The rooms are splendid, with guaranteed Wi-Fi connection and perfectly air-conditioned !

I am currently staying here and I am very impressed with the service. Staff is very courteous and hospitable. Food is great. I am here with 2 teenage boys and they went to eat at the buffet all alone. One had the egusi soup and he gave it a 10/10. He is an egusi expert.   I had the food too and I gave high marks too. I have just booked a return visit in a few days. I used my Marriott rewards points for all the rooms, for just 7,500 points per room per night, you just can't beat that. The rate of these rooms on the Marriott website for cash was $250.

It is a small cozy hotel, I found it great for business traveller. With nice facilities of a small swimming pool. Nearby to government offices and a shopping mall.  The hotel staff were courteous and helpful,

Am a flight Attedant in Middle East. I travel alot and can make out greatness from the hotel staff and staff at the Protea Select are exceptionaly respectful, always smilling and ready to lend a hand, from the cleaning lady to the receptionists and waiters. My favourite is Femi, he is very informative and helpful. Kudos guys

The decor, ambiance and staff were picture perfect. I went simply to dine and was absolutely satisfied. Definitely one of the choicest hotels in West Africa (in my opinion). I will definitely recommend trying out there menu especially  if you are a "just got back" type as I was frequently referred as by family & friends (ask a Nigeria what that means if the saying mentioned in quotes has thrown you off). Great place. Keep up the great customer satisfaction.

I had a short stay to Protea Hotel but enough time to see what a wonderful staff they have. Very mannered, very helpful and approachable.  The hotel is very clean and you can have access to the pool area where you can have drinks and coconut chips (the best). Don't hesitate to try chef Jannie's speciality chicken stew with jollif rice and a glass of South Africa's  sauvignon blanc. You'll feel the rainbow in your mouth.  I'm looking forward to come back!

The hotel is not bad at all. Food is really expensive but so are all the restaurants in good hotels.   The rooms are a good size, great staff and really friendly waiters.   My only complaint was that I requested they remove all feathers in the room and the did not do that on day one. It was eventually changed

Review Title: Very good but expected a bit more
Review Text: This is a quite pricey hotel for Lagos Mainland so I had high expectations.  The standard room I stayed in was quite small but tastefully furnished and the bed was very comfortable. I loved the separate shower in the bathroom but it's a bit small especially for two people in a romantic getaway situation. Everywhere was very clean and smelled nice. As a tv girl, I wish there were more channels to choose from. Breakfast was quite delicious but I expected more food items on the buffet spread and felt the staff could have been more attentive.  My overall experience was good and I will definitely stay here again and recommend it if you don't mind the high price.
Review Text

A good small hotel with friendly and nice service by the staff. The rooms are just ok . The restaurant is average food quality but friendly environment. The bar is small and nice served . Pool didn't used but looks ok.

I arrived in Lagos this morning, 12th October 2015, and due to traffic, went straight into my business meetings. I was worried about not having checked into the hotel first but my fears were allayed by a very warm and understanding receptionist when I called.  The lady assured me that they would still check me in late and that I should carry on with my business meeting.  First class!  She definitely understands where we get money to pay for the hotel!  I definitely recommend this hotel but be ready to withstand the lagos traffic (Took me three hours to get here).

The day was 28/09/2015 when I took a walk to secretariat Alausa in Ikeja local Government area of Lagos state for a review of what Protea Hotel look exactly like and was numbed for minutes.  Protea Hotel Select Ikeja, Lagos to me can be rated a top class hotel located at plot 2, Assibifi road off Alausa secretariat, Ikeja. Protea Hotel is located in a mildly-busy environment that could take less than an hour drive to the Local and international airport, it is just less than 3mins walk to shopprite Mall, its rooms are well spaced with top class facilities. The Hotel offersthe best available rate of the day (N 198.98 to 1USD) which is subject to change without prior notice.  The room types include classic, Inter- leading, Paraplegic, Delux and Suite as well as

Visited the hotel couple of time but mainly just to hang out and take buffet. Lovely environment, very polite,friendly and helpful staff. Wonderful food too,neat environment and very secured.Also the poolside is a very lovely site especially at night with the very lovely jazz at Fridays.

I am so glad that this hotel was added in Lagos, as it is almost literally around the corner from my company's local office, and makes the morning/evening commute a breeze! Aside from that, it's your standard Protea Hotel, all clean, comfortable, and very welcoming friendly service! The rooms are a good size, the restaurant has 2 seating areas adjacent to one another, with a nice small bar area alongside, and my favourite was probably the outdoor pool area, a great spot to relax after work with a drink! Will definitely stay here on my next trip!

Review Title: Nice place with very friendly staff
Review Text: It's a great place with great food and friendly staff. The rooms are clean and chilling (cold), the closest attraction is the Ikeja City Mall which is only a stone throw from the hotel. Protea Select close proximity to both local and international airport is another plus.

We travel to Nigeria several times per year, and this is a new hotel opened last year ( 2014 )  Great hotel. Rooms a little small if you have to share and staying more than a few days. Restaurant good, staff friendly. But as with all hotels in Lagos, very expensive compared to most other countries we travel to.

Review Title: Cozy hotel with Great Customer Service
Review Text: This is my 3rd hotel to visit in Lagos and so fare it ia the best. The rooms are clean, cozy and confortable. When we did arrive Miss Elizabeth was there to brief us about the hotel facilities. She was really amazing with her bubbly personality and smile. The overall stay was nice. Few things to improve which is the water pressure of the showers is very low and the area where the hotel is had 8 short power failures that night. I do believe that they can invest on a back up power generator.

The roms are clean , the amenities are cheap quality, the mini bar is empty.. the wifi signal is weak, the pool is very small and the most deceiving is the restaurant & buffet . The food is inedible, rally limited choices and the prices are very expensive , a mediocre steak for 50 US dollars.. Would not recommend it at all

Review Title: A great wee addition to Lagos
Review Text: I have stayed in various Protea's across Nigeria and this is a great addition to Lagos and Ikeja.  It is located across from the International mall in Ikeja and is only 15 minutes from the airport.  It only opened last year and is obviously building up the customer base.  Located in a very secure compound and finished to a very high standard.  The rooms are small and business like but with everything you need - including free wireless.  The staff are really friendly and welcoming and the breakfast is very good!  I will definitely use this hotel again when working in Lagos.  It is also very well priced for Lagos at about £150 per night.
Review Text

Iv become a part of the protea family  as i make it an aim to come here twice a month. For whilst sone call it Africa, I call it home. I love the freindly staff at this hotel and il mention a few, the chef, Jones , waiter vincent, and michael from the reception make life easy. The last time we had a pool party and the managers were soo happy they offered us  a free barbercue and drinks. Its not really the fanciest place to be as its located far from any tourist attractions. It however has a mall nearby which is convenient as its  just across their road. Im a sucker for peace and quiet as i value my rest above everything. If youre like me this is your place. Despite their food being scrumciously delicious, they offer a free breakfast which is overly nice and i promise you i can

Excellent location close to everything, especially the airport. Rooms are good, neat, claen and funcional. Wifi is excellent. Staff are very friendly and helpful and service is good. Tawo who works at the bar and restuarant gives excellent service. Breakfast choice is wide and dinner buffet is good with different selections each night. If you order off the menu though expect to wait a long time. They are not really eqipped for this. The only thing I didn't lie was the extremely hard matress on the bed. It was like sleeping on a board!

Great hospitable place in the hustle bustle of Lagos.Very friendly staff.Great dinner and breakfast buffet.Rooms very clean and beautifully furnished.Internet very reliable.Stunning modern pool area.Large shopping mall with a good selection of restaurants and shops,across the road from the hotel.

This hotel is perfect for Nigeria/Lagos. The most important thing is hotel is really clean and luxury. Everthing is same as the pictures. And hotel has a new building. If you are not realy really sensitive you can eat the meats. Taste is very good for me. Also you should try the fruits. You have all time electricity and this is very important here. If you will visit Lagos you can stay at this hotel here nothing will be problem.

Review Title: A friendly, clean and comfortable place, in the right location and at the right price
Review Text: Great location in central Ikeja, brand new, super friendly and helpful staff, clean and comfortable.  It has everything a business traveler needs in a hotel, feels like an expensive hotel, but at a very affordable rate.  I will stay there every time I come to Lagos now as will all my teammates.  It is a diamond in the rough.  Don't, however, come here expecting a destination bar and restaurant or other fancy amenities.  They have all these things - restaurant, bar, pool, gym, business center, etc. - but they are minimal and you know what?  That's just perfect for me as a business traveler.  The food is very good, the drinks are reasonable and they treat you like an old friend.  What else could you ask for?

Review Title: A quiet, cosy gem of a hotel, close to the airport
Review Text: This is a great hotel - it is small, comfortable and very close to the airport.  The hotel is new, and  finding its feet but the staff are very friendly and helpful, and management is very visible all the time.  There is the Ikeja shopping mall literally across the road - so an added bonus!
